page.title: 16SETTLEMENT
page.content: This area has probably been continuously settled for at least 5000 years from Neolithic Man to the Romans to the present day.Today most of its population lives in the small nucleated village of East Meon.Some people also live in the smaall Hamlets of Frogmore (east of East Meon) and Ramsdean (north of Butser Hill).The rest of the population lives in the 14 or so scattered farms (such as South Farm,Preston Farm and Harroway Farm) and in the 2 or 3 large houses (such as Oxenbourne House and Leythe House and in 1 or 2 groups of isolated cottages (e.g Fishpond Cottages).The steep slopes of Butser Hill in the south of the area are today unused for permanent settlement although the presence of Tumuli and Cross-Dykes testify to their attraction for earlier inhabitants of this area.
